byline.contributor: Sue Skalicky reported from Cannon Ball, and Monica Davey from Chicago. Brett Williamson contributed reporting from Cannon Ball.
byline.original: By SUE SKALICKY and MONICA DAVEY

abstract: North Dakota authorities report arrest of at least 142 protesters near Standing Rock Sioux Reservation on charges of engaging in riot and conspiracy to endanger; demonstrators and law enforcement officials. until mass arrests, had maintained state of precarious tension regarding protests of planned oil Energy Transfer Partners pipeline project.
lead_paragraph: The tension had been building for months, with Native Americans who had camped out saying that the Dakota Access pipeline threatens the region’s water supply.
snippet: The tension had been building for months, with Native Americans who had camped out saying that the Dakota Access pipeline threatens the region’s water supply....

headline.main: Tension Between Police and Standing Rock Protesters Reaches Boiling Point
headline.print_headline: Tension Over Pipeline Hits Boiling Point
